rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Induction sur des objects dans le champ électrostatique des lignes très haute tension
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Le but de ce travail est d'arriver à la détermination du niveau d'induction (de tension et de courant lorsqu'un contact au sol est établi) sur un objet placé dans le champ électrostatique d'une ligne triphasée à très haute tension. Cet objet peut être quelconque mais plutôt de dimensions finies, v.g. un camion ou une remorque, de sorte que l'étude est essentiellement à trois dimensions. Ceci d'ailleurs explique le fait qu'aucune étude théorique, à la connaissance de l'auteur, n'existe sur ce sujet. On connait bien le phénomène d'induction électrostatique sur un fil ou câble parallèle à une ligne sous tension lorsque ces conducteurs sont de longueur infinie, mais ceci ne nécessite qu'une étude en deux dimensions et ne comporte que des objets cylindriques. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Energy
Engineering, Electronics and Electrical

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A study of the error function limiting of Gaussian random processes
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The problem of limiting a random process is considered. The output autocorrelation function of a smooth limiter is determined as a function of the limiter parameters. A stationary gaussian random process of zero mean and arbitrary autocorrelation function is assumed for the input. The transfer characteristic of the limiter is defined by a translated error function. This definition permits the study of smooth limiting with various degrees of limiting and bias. Solutions that are amenable to numerical computation are obtained for the full wave (odd) and half wave biased error function limiter. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Engineering, Electronics and Electrical

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Velocity profiles and pumping capacities of turbine type impellers
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Velocity profiles of propeller and turbine type impellers were measured in both air and water using a hot wire anemometer probe, and two and three dimensional pitot tubes. These pitot probes were particularly suitable for this work, since they permitted the measurement of velocity and inclination of flow in the turbine jet, from which the radial and tangential velocity components were evaluated. [...]

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Determination of optimum controller parameter values by digital simulation
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The problem of determining optimum parameter values for a proportional plus Integral plus derivative controller is considered. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Engineering, Mechanical

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The cuticle of the house cricket, Acheta domesticus (L.)
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The literature on insect cuticle is considerable. Wigglesworth (1956) wrote: "The key to much of the physiology of insects is to be found in the nature of their cuticle." We should not be surprised, therefore, that so much information has been gathered on the subject. But this information is manifold. It concerns the morphology, chemistry, formation, permeability and physiology of the insect integument. No elaborate technique, apart from the use of the microscope, was necessary for the study of the external surface of the cuticle. But accumulatuion of information about the way the cuticle was formed and its constituents had to wait for the advent of more elaborate tools. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Crickets

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A spherical harmonic analysis of the global 1000 mb surface for September 1957
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Characteristic features of the long atmospheric waves are discussed on the basis of spherical harmonic analysis of global weather charts for September 1957. At first, there is a discussion of the Trapezoidal and Simpson's numerical integration rules as applied to the computation of the Spherical harmonic coefficients. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Spherical harmonics
Meteorology
Atmosphere
